data.title: [Editor] Spatial Node Gizmo Not Disabled When Loading A Scene With Spatial Node Visibility Disabled.
data.body: When loading a scene where a Spatial Node has been disabled, the Spatial Node appear indeed disabled but not its Gizmo (camera,light,..) which is still shown.

data.title: "Show Children" shows nothing
data.body: When i am too deep in hierarchy the "Show Children" can be checked or unchecked, but it doesn't show the children. Only "Open in Editor" works.

data.title: Scene Switcher Tutorial may be outdated
data.body:
Followed the [Scene Switcher](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/tutorial_singletons#scene-switcher) tutorial instructions exactly (no typos).

After saving the three scripts I then hit play and clicked the button. The program failed with the following error: `Invalid Call. Unexisting function 'remove' in base 'Viewport'.`

I tried replacing the line

`get_scene().get_root().remove(current_scene)` with `get_scene().get_root().remove_node(current_scene)` but encountered the same error.

data.title: collisions not working for Node2D root note at start
data.body:
I was doing https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/tutorial_instancing but from scratch. I remade that project nearly identically, but there was one difference - I have used Node2D for root node in container.scn. And all that collision system was not working - ball was falling down. When I changed Node2D to Node it started working.... And now is the weird: when I changed back from Node to Node2D it was now working OK.

commit: 37354da5b0dc1dc8dcfd9d844e593935311f4f8f (current HEAD when writing this report)
Tested on OS X, tommorow going to test on ArchLinux

data.title: Remove camera check for 2D audio listener.
data.body: Fixes #747 because for 2D you only set a canvas transform and not a camera like on 3D camera.cpp

data.title: Blender exporter (parenting mesh to bone)
data.body:
Parenting a mesh to a single bone of an armature in blender is not supported when exported in Godot,which means that the mesh doesen't move if the bone moves.

![rigging_eyes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7304933/4593376/8452318c-5085-11e4-8d37-133281997cb2.jpg)

data.title: UV texture aligns wrong for imported Mesh?
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Open untilded.blend (file in https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BwDtvsC8_NUGUHlqR25pUDEwZ1E/view?usp=sharing) in blender.
2) In UV editor "Save image as..." somwhere on your drive.
3) Select cube in 3d scene
3) File->Export as OBJ with defaults settings and "include UV's'',"Selected only" checked.
4) Import exported OBJ as 3d Mesh in Godot scene
5) Import saved texture (3d or 2d - doesn't matter)
6) Add MeshInstance and select the importet mesh from OBJ
7) Add New Fixed Material
8) For the material set the Diffuse texture the one importet earlier (if not by default, set Diffuse tc to "UV")
9) The texture is aligned wrong

Best, Janis

data.title: GridMap Updates Only Once After Re-Export
data.body:
So this is kind of an edge case, but GridMaps using a MeshLibrary file only update once after overwriting that MeshLibrary file with a new one. After this, you have to restart Godot for the changes to happen. To describe my process in more detail:

1) Import a scene of tiles and convert it to a MeshLibrary.
2) Create a GridMap and use the MeshLibrary as the theme.
3) Reimport the scene of tiles and convert it to a MeshLibrary, not merging it with the previous MeshLibrary file, but overwriting it.
4) Check the GridMap, and it should update with the new tiles.
5) Repeat 3 and 4, but the GridMap no longer updates with new tiles.

This being a weird situation, if necessary I can provide a video showing the problem in action. Thanks.

data.title: Godot is not friendly with tiling window managers
data.body:
I'm user of [SpectrWM](https://github.com/conformal/spectrwm/wiki), a _small dynamic tiling window manager for Xorg_.

There are two issues:
1. all the Godot windows (the project list, the editor and the game preview) have exactly the same _class_ and _instance_ according to `xprop | grep -E "^(WM_CLASS|_NET_WM_NAME|WM_NAME)"`, this makes me unable to change the tiling behavior according to each different window, i.e.: making the game preview window float over the rest of windows. And,
2. The elements of any windows do not accommodate to the window size upon startup, look:
   ![godot-mal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1055216/4554973/25b8ed3e-4eb7-11e4-9dc6-f0d7797a90dc.png)
   I have to float the window and then stack it again in order to get the elements of Godot's UI accommodate to the size of the window when stacked:
   Floating: 
   ![godot-float](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1055216/4555006/7dd46908-4eb7-11e4-8737-c49163679592.png)
   re-stacked: 
   ![godot-bien](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1055216/4555011/8ac2c38a-4eb7-11e4-9343-cfc97776640d.png)
   After this, Godot is able to fit the GUI properly.

Hope this bug report makes sense. Having this fix before Godot hits version 1.0 is a good idea, so I better report this now.

data.title: Fix android build on windows
data.body:
- use ".so" suffix for android windows build ( instead of ".dll" )
- use "libgodot.android.debug.so" output file format (instead of "libgodot_android.android.debug.so"), to be consistent with file name on other platforms.

Fix issue #757 
- Move libraries from LIBS to LINKFLAGS
- Remove redundant .exe surfix on windows

data.title: Godot Crashes At Exit (Editor/Game) in Windows 7 With Latest Commit
data.body:
Since the new build system update, Godot now crashes in Windows 7 whenever exiting Godot Editor or a Game. It is not crashing in Windows 8.

It was not crashing in Windows 7 with previous Godot commits.

Tested with vc10 build (x86) and vc12 builds (x86 & x64).

data.title: Godot silently closing when trying to load a scene
data.body: Happened after the latest commit with the build system changes. I'm using 32-bit Linux (openSUSE)

data.title: Fixed compiler flags for 32-bit environments
data.body: Fixes the "sorry, unimplemented: 64-bit mode not compiled in" message when trying to compile godot for x11 on 32-bit GNU/Linux.

data.title: Scene Import Update Logic Failing
data.body:
According to the Wiki, Godot supports updating 3D scene imports. So, if I'm correct in my understanding, this would allow one to:

> Import a scene from a DAE file, 
> Alter the imported scene in Godot (i.e. instance other children scenes into it, alter properties in the scene, etc),
> Alter the source file and re-export into the same DAE file,
> And then update the Godot scene to reflect the changes.

So this would allow one to effectively build both the structural "shape" of objects or scenes in Blender, for example, while also building the scene up hierarchically and functionally in Godot without having to start fresh after each scene import.

This logic appears to be wholly missing in Godot, as I couldn't get Godot to update the scene rather than just import it fresh (or do nothing). My attempts and results are:

> On selecting the ! in the top-right corner and checking my scene I'm trying to update, the scene reloads, but has been unchanged.
> 
> On choosing to "Re-import" from the Import menu, the scene is rolled back to the correct data from the DAE file, but none of the changes I've made in Godot.
> 
> On choosing to import "3D Scene" from the Import menu, it similarly is rolled back to the correct data from the DAE file, but none of the changes I've made in Godot.

If necessary, I can provide a video of the process failing or an example project zip. Thanks.

Associated forum thread about it here:
http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=981
